13A04A637267453B935BD1F9AAC90130.description: A student identifies and discusses aspects of their own and others’ learning

5A2949A72C2444438FB775EB8AD9DEE4.description: A student responds to and composes a range of texts about familiar aspects of the world and their own experiences

1E92B0B006E24304857CF69A36FC26A1.description: A student thinks imaginatively and creatively about familiar topics, ideas and texts when responding to and composing texts

CD836727F3604833A8597C5241FD1EB6.description: A student uses basic grammatical features, punctuation conventions and vocabulary appropriate to the type of text when responding to and composing texts

B8EA6F2C794444CAA41D5DC012BE19EA.description: A student recognises that there are different kinds of texts when reading and viewing and shows an awareness of purpose, audience and subject matter

3548024FF46343C1940FAB9EA5B32FD9.description: A student recognises a range of purposes and audiences for spoken language and recognises organisational patterns and features of predictable spoken texts

B2B5DE0F2FA541D9ACFD6B6705580DD1.description: A student draws on an increasing range of skills and strategies to fluently read, view and comprehend a range of texts on less familiar topics in different media and technologies

B0355B4F79A947388D9C3C9605921E16.description: A students plans, composes and reviews a small range of simple texts for a variety of purposes on familiar topics for known readers and viewers

8C333659DC17405CB8263E1D499649E9.description: A student communicates with a range of people in informal and guided activities demonstrating interaction skills and considers how own communication is adjusted in different situations
